::Zardus::

Zardus nods, looking at Cerbeus. He opens his mouth to say something, 
interrupted by a transmission. He looks down at his wrist comp, his 
eyes widening slightly. Ominous Prime! Ominous had been one of the 
original supporters of the Alliance, and a great ally as well as a 
strong adversary afterward. And now, the Energonian wanted to talk.

Zardus smiles to himself. This could really come out well. "I'm 
afraid I can't accompany you to your base right now. I have a very 
important meeting, with an .. old friend."

DevilDuer walks into the bridge, looking at Zardus.

"Devil, go to the entrance to the Iron Fist. When Ominous arrives, 
escort him to the conference room," Zardus says. DevilDuer nods and 
walks out of one of the doors, exiting the Iron Fist.

While Zardus was relaying orders to DevilDuer, his comm was sending a 
reply to Ominous Prime. "Ominous, this is Zardus. I must admit I 
didn't expect to hear from you again. One of my soldiers will be 
waiting at the entrance to my base. He'll lead you to the conference 
room."







--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, JP3884@a... wrote:
>     "How is the energon supply?" Demanded Subcommander Putnam. He 
held an 
> inventory list and looked at Odiphious, the one who was responsible 
for the 
> upkeep of the energon.
>     He replied, "We have met the week's quota. Why? We have enough 
energy." 
> HE asked, not knowing what Ominous was up too.
>     Putname smiled. "The Commander has something planned for all of 
it. 
> Something big. I dont know what it is, but whoever its for is going 
to be 
> sorry."
> 
>     Ominous was on level one, better known as the Facility. In this 
level of 
> the Orb were the many labs for Liquid Energon. Also, all the mining 
deposits 
> ended up in the holding tanks on this level.
>     "Akron, get ready, the Fuz is powerful." He said. They were in 
the middle 
> of the Liquid Energon process. Fuzzing it into Liquid was 
dangerous, and a 
> back lash occasionally happened.
>     As the energon slowly melted from the radiation, it released a 
fantastic 
> blue fume. It was a beautiful glow, almost heavenly. And the thing 
Ominous 
> wanted more than ever. It was the very unstable Energon gas. 
Unfortunetly, it 
> dissolved within minutes. He couldnt figure out how to keep it from 
fadding 
> away.
>     "So, what are you planning to do with all this energon boss?" 
She asked, 
> through pink optics.
>     Ominous gave a sinister smile, but then agian, all of his 
smiles were 
> sinister. "I have a plan. ALl will be reveiled soon Akron. But, You 
and I 
> need to go and have a talk with an old associate of mine."
>     Akron looked forward to getting out of the Orb. "And who would 
that be?" 
>     Ominous paused. The name of this person was a powerful one, one 
that held 
> much respect, and fear, around here. "Allience Commander Zardus. 
He's our 
> ticket to domination."
>     "I thought you wanted to destroy all Transformers!" She said, a 
tone of 
> anger in her sweet voice. "Why would we make a pact with them?"
>     Ominous, "Because Akron, the Allience is powerful, very much 
so. With 
> thier help we could do some major killing. And then of course we 
would 
> convert them into Energonians."
>     She still didnt like the idea, but nodded like a good soldier.
>     "Besides, with what Im cooking up, I doubt any non-Energonian 
would 
> survive. He, and his minions, wont have much or a choice."
> 
>     They departed the Orb, and Madagascar completely. Headed towrds 
the 
> Allience HQ in a simple two person transport. Ominous was never one 
for 
> walking, and now that he had his very own Energonian Vessle, with 
all sorts 
> of toys, he was going to use them.
>     Tapping the communication panle, he spoke. "Zardus, or any 
ranking 
> Allience Member, this is Commander Ominous Prime of the Energonian 
Empire. I 
> wish to hold an audience with Zardus. I am an hours journey from 
your 
> location. Please respond soon."
>     "Do you think they will listen to what we have to say?" Akron 
asked from 
> the seat directly behinde him in the small cockpit.
>     Ominous turned his silver head a bit, "They'll listen. I know 
Zardus, and 
> he knows when an oppertunity comes his way. We wont be turned away."
>     The small transport sped onward, over the blue ocean with white 
capped 
> waves and the occasional dolphin leaping up to greet them.
